komar12345

Was excited about using the wood block until I realized you couldn't place it directionally. Needless to say I was quite disappointed. This block has the potential to be very useful but it really falls short. It's mostly useless in its current state. Please allow wood blocks to be placed directionally.

Yes, I desperately need to be able to choose the top/bottom grain direction. The log interior texture works without it because it already has radial symmetry, but when the top/bottom is bark textured, there's not enough control.

You can literally just do the following procedures:

Throw in lava

Throw in the void

Drop it and let it despawn

Blow it up

This block is literally useless and not needed at all seeing that there are much more simpler ways of doing this.

I think an interesting follow up to this is instead of a needlessly complex block as you stated, or a less attractive design as the comment before me, maybe a "crafting" table style block that can take useless items and make them useful. A recycler

Or just a more attractive box that you can put unwanted items in for them to disappear. This could be done with the barrel, so that it's looked at as a trash can. You put the item in, and instead of storing it, it just goes away.
It can be crafted with gold and can also explain why piglins are interested in bells.
If the bell is smelted,it produce a gold ingot

The crafting recipe for the bell could be:

wood planks/wood planks/wood planks

empty/gold ingot/empty

gold ingot/gold ingot/gold ingot
The upgrade version of the Bow is the Crossbow.
What do you mean by no bullet drop? There are no bullets in Minecraft.
Bamboo has a use for making Scaffolding.
Bamboo is also used to make Sticks that can be used to make Bows.

@Blast Burner
The crossbow is not an upgraded version of the bow, is an alternative version because it works totally different, what else could I mean by bullet drop? Obviously arrows. And I also didn't say that bamboo is useless, I only say that it could be an important usage.

@Omargabagu01 I never said that you said that Bamboo was useless but judging from my commentary, I can see where you got that from. Also it's kinda hard to understand what you mean by bullet drop. Maybe next time say ammo because some people might think that there would be bullets for Bows even though there never will be.
I like this idea. :)
A bamboo bow should be faster than a regular bow, but less durable.

It should be possible to germinate ordinary potatoes in sunlight so that they become poisonous.
Planting pre-sprouted potatoes increases the yield by about a quarter.
These could be enchantments. Elytra have never had unique enchantments and this would be the perfect place to implement them.

When I finally found the elytra, I thought I would see the world like a falcon, but instead, I felt like I was operating a motor aircraft. The reasons:

–Perspective is locked in the direction to which one is flying to. Birds can look down. Imagine looking down and seeing the dizzying height... without nose diving towards the ground and losing elevation. This would bring so much more depth to flight by elytra.

–Computer is slow and chunks don't load quick enough. A solution would be to have an enchantment that decreases velocity and perhaps increases glide ratio, similar to how slow falling does.

–I am operating a propelled aircraft! Make flying more strategic by adding thermals and wind, perhaps in a weather update. Another benefit from this is the fact that airspeed and windspeed are two different values, i.e. a landing station is up ahead, and enough wind is blowing to make a slow and steady (very easy) approach onto the station.
This would take away the purpose of the Enchantment Table.

How about expansion on enchantments plus uses for smithing table.

So, the smithing table should give efficiency, bonus durability, protection, and more physical things.

The enchanting table should give things like mending, fire aspect, bonus health, and more magical things.

This is what Mojang might do. I hope so!
The enchantment table is much too random, why people turn to AFK fishing farms. This would add more control for the player.
I would love them to add on the s thing table where you have a platform and using blocks you can costumize ur own armor and make it real armor kind of like a workshop mod
I would love them to add on the s thing table where you have a platform and using blocks you can costumize ur own armor and make it real armor kind of like a workshop mod

i don't think if those improvements have to be related with enchantment, they just would be another type of buff, like you add a material to a weapon in it, and it'll boost one of it's stats, like lead would increase it's durability, iron block increases the damage, etc. once an item is added only the same item can be added to buff the same stats

So how do you craft a Locator Map? Could you please explain how to do so?
In Minecraft when you are creating a world you can click starting map. Another way is eight paper and a compass plus locator maps are already in Minecraft.
Okay but they aren't called that. They're called Maps.
There are maps AND locator maps! OK
Oh. I'm sorry SpookZ21. You didn't mention that Locator Maps were only in Bedrock Edition unless you didn't know. As for me I play the Java version so I had no idea. Please forgive me.

Great idea!

Wait, you have a good point. Striker would be nice but what would it be brewed with, frost powder?

And unrelated, but I always find it weird that we brew strength potions from blaze powder. Why was it never something like a ferocious beasts horn/fang/claw/whatever?
This would be a good balance for only upgrading long ranged attacks.

It should naturally vary between villagers, so I'd say,
12-16 golden carrots, for 1.5-2 times as many emeralds, so 18-32 emeralds depending on the number of carrots per trade and the exchange rate, for the trading villager.
For golden apples, being more powerful, in my opinion, it should be 6-9 apples, for 2-3 times as many emeralds, so 12-27.
Since giant mushrooms can be found in Roofed forests, It's a nice idea to add something(plant life) more to the mushroom biome, that can only be found there.

Interesting idea. Maybe it's just a tree stump with no leaves; a dead tree. The bark looks like rainbow eucalyptus but shows primarily the purple-gray streaks, as that is similar to mycelium. And rather than having mushrooms drop randomly, this type of wood could be the only place where a new kind of mushroom/lichen/fungus/moss grows. This new growing thing could have some use for survival (perhaps light source or potion). The wood under the bark could have the look of driftwood (bleached white or grayish).

Different types of sticks would also allow us to craft different types of ladders, item frames and torches. So that they can blend-in better with the wood blocks they are placed on.

+1

I would have a more detailed idea on the effects it could give.

The effects when eating a raw Netherchilli:
Jump boost 2 for 3 seconds
Speed 2 for 3 seconds
Strenght 1 for 3 seconds
Nausea for 10 seconds
1 heart of damage.

Eating a roasted Netherchilli gives you:
Jump boost 2 for 6 seconds
Speed 2 for 6 seconds
Strenght 1 for 6 seconds
Nausea for 10 seconds
2 hearts of damage.

The Netherchilli grows on bushes in the Nether on Soulsand. Harvesting them from the bush gives you 2 to 4 Netherchillis. The bush remains until you break the empty bush too.

In order to replant a Netherchilli in your base, you need to process a Netherchilli in the crafting table into Netherchilli seeds. You can plant them on Soulsand, which makes a Netherchilli bush appear.

If you step on a Netherchilli bush, you get set on fire. If you die from it, your drops don't get destroyed, but any raw meat or raw potato you had in your inventory will be roasted if it fell into the bush with Netherchillis.

If a farm animal dies from walking through a Netherchilli bush, it will drop roasted meat.

Also op, I don't know if the admins will take your type of writing seriously, it's not a roast, but I don't like the way you wrote the post, thank you.^^

You and any other mob can't catch on fire by a Campfire so you couldn't get any cooked food.

What if mobs avoided campfires. 

Like a deterrent for wolves, not that they attack normally, but maybe spiders could avoid getting too close to campfires.
